title: Work - work done by gravity on two dropped blocks

content.question: Two small, identical blocks, Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are dropped from rest at different heights above a horizontal floor. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> immediately before hitting the floor, and Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has speed <math alttext="2 times v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> immediately before hitting the floor. The work done by gravity on Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> as it falls is <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. What is the work done by gravity on Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> as it falls?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
